Meaning - You could invest in a high dividend security such as IBM or even ETF such as HANDL which pay 5 and 7%. Even with an ETF expense ratio, your opportunity cost is much lower, and return much higher with either one. 

The point is that as it stands, even with liquidity, HOOD price action is poor. Any investor that is waiting for HOOD to appreciate and level past 16 may be better off investing elsewhere.

The broader market's IV crush for stocks in $SPY turned out to be less severe than the options were for $MSFT. The average earnings IV crush left ATM options with around 60% of their pre-announcement IV. 
 
https://quantcha.com/news/an-analysis-of-trading-earnings-releases-using-options/

We broadened the analysis beyond $MSFT for all optionable stocks at earnings from 2016-March 2022. The only filter was for option liquidity using a liquidity rating of 4+ to ensure feasibility. This data is available through our Quantcha Option Ratings DB via Nasdaq: https://data.nasdaq.com/data/QOR-us-equity-option-ratings

Long calendar straddles weren't always profitable for $MSFT earnings and were subject to losing all their value if the underlying moved too much. However, they were profitable 14/25 times and produced an average net of almost 33% (caveat: EOD midpoints). 
 
https://quantcha.com/news/an-analysis-of-trading-earnings-releases-using-options/

In our research, the long calendar straddle was the most effective way to trade $MSFT earnings. It involves selling the earnings week ATM straddle and buying the next week's ATM straddle. 
 
https://quantcha.com/news/an-analysis-of-trading-earnings-releases-using-options/

The Earnings Crush Rate can be compared with the long-term IV to infer the "richness" earnings is being priced with for stocks like $MSFT. This gives you an idea of how IV is priced so you can decide whether it's worth selling against longer-term IV (spoiler: it usually is). 
https://quantcha.com/news/an-analysis-of-trading-earnings-releases-using-options/
